column4: well, you can download the single package without root with aptitude download package_name; it will download it to the current directory
without root (or you could get the source and rebuild the package with apt-get source package_name; without being root)
that isn't really the nicest way since you can't start them manually later
but so does: echo manual | sudo tee /etc/init/servicename.override;
the firefox-stable ppa will no longer be updated, since the latest versions are being added to lucid-oneiric now
Ubuntu keeping up-to-date? That's just funny xD Finally
yeah just announced a couple days ago: http://www.chriscoulson.me.uk/blog/?p=100
we don't have systemd in ubuntu, it is in debian though
sun-java isn't in the repos anymore though
Oh well, old stuff is old, I don't touch old stuff
